The place was very rustic with plenty of wood to decorate the walls and ceiling. Their was a beautiful new handmade dining room table and new stove and washer and dryer which all worked wonderfully. This is a jewel of place! Quiet, spacious, and comfy!!
I spent 10 days for work, and truly enjoyed the comfort of this place. It is unexpectedly more lovely than the photos could show. And Irene is a phenomenal host - incredibly responsive on even the smallest things. She made a special trip to drop off a steamer basket for my vegetables.
I have a back that requires a lot of TLC, and I was delighted in the ways that this place pampered it. The master has a “Goldilocks” bed - it’s just right!! It is the best bed I’ve slept in - both hotel and owner rental - in 3 years. Also, the pair of recliners in the living room were so comfortable to read and relax in.
The other issue I have is a sensitivity to mold and mildew. I had ZERO problems the whole time I was staying, even when I was in the basement for laundry. There is a dehumidifier running in the basement, which I’m sure helps.
Irene has thought of many little things that make the stay feel more like home. There were sound machines in each bedroom, night lights, plenty of Kleenex, tp, soap, shampoo, etc. The kitchen was very well equipped (TWO crockpots!). And the washer and dryer looked practically new and handled huge loads.
This house is family-friendly, with a play area set up in the basement. There is a power-lift recliner chair in the living room, if you have someone who needs assistance in getting up. Plus there is a grab bar for getting out of the shower. Be aware, however, that there are steps on both entrances to the house.
I would definitely recommend this place to anyone. A drawback is having only one bathroom - but it is spacious and lovely, with a tub that both accessible and comfortable. Another issue I had was there wasn’t enough internet to sustain my Zoom meetings - however, I expect that when the WiFi password gets re-established that this problem will vanish.
Just as an FYI, the IGA is close by and does pick-up orders with no minimum and no fees. I chose to stay in an AirBnb so that I could make my own meals and avoid eating in restaurants as a Covid precaution. It was easy to pick up my groceries on the way to the house.
Another coworker stayed at a local hotel and paid $35 more a day and got far, far less than I did!
